questionList.choiceB: Constitution and specific laws do NOT have any relation

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following gives ultimate decisions according to the Ethiopian law?

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about budget allocation for different regions of Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: The federal government allocates and distributes money reasonably based on the specific situations of different regions
questionList.choiceB: The federal government allocates equal amount of money to all Nations, Nationalities and peoples of Ethiopia
questionList.choiceC: The federal government allocates less amount of money to less developed regions
questionList.choiceD: The federal government allocates large amount of money to better developed regions

questionList.choiceB: The major destination of women migrants is South Africa

questionList.choiceA: Transfer of global information and knowledge .
questionList.choiceB: Dependence of economically weak nations on the developed ones
questionList.choiceC: Market competition between economically weak and strong nation

questionList.questionStatement: In what way did Ethiopia protect her independence from foreign aggressions in the past few centuries?
questionList.choiceD: Through the support of western Great powers

questionList.questionStatement: Why are elected officials accountable to their electorate? It is because
questionList.choiceA: They should listen to the grievances of the electorate.
questionList.choiceB: The electorate is the source of their political power.
questionList.choiceC: They need to have constant contact with their electors.
questionList.choiceD: The electorate can replace them with another if anytime.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following statements is true about progressive taxation?
questionList.choiceA: Varying tax rates are levied on people who earn equal income.
questionList.choiceB: People are expected to pay tax at a rate proportionate to their income.
questionList.choiceC: People who earn more pay equal tax with those who earn less.
questionList.choiceD: Rich people are taxed more while the poor are exempted from it

questionList.questionStatement: One similarity between parliamentary and presidential democracies is that both cases:
questionList.choiceA: The head of state is elected by the members of parliament.
questionList.choiceB: The head of state is elected directly by popular vote.
questionList.choiceC: There is a smooth and peaceful transition of state power.
questionList.choiceD: Government is formed most of the time by coalition of parties.

questionList.questionStatement: Concerning Human Rights what governments are required to do is
questionList.choiceA: Insure that they are NOT violated by anyone.
questionList.choiceB: Introduce new types of rights for their people.
questionList.choiceC: Coordinate their use with social development.
questionList.choiceD: Grant them to the mature section of society.

questionList.questionStatement: Any law that contradicts a constitution of a country is
questionList.choiceD: Replaces some articles in the constitution.

questionList.choiceA: To become an alternative force for the East and West in the Cold War.
questionList.choiceB: To promote economic cooperation between developing countries.
questionList.choiceC: To advocate solutions to global social and political problems.
questionList.choiceD: To be neutral in the East and West confrontation of the Cold War

questionList.questionStatement: In democratic countries officials are expected to be non-partisan while performing their duties. This means?
questionList.choiceA: They should NOT be prejudiced in anyway.
questionList.choiceC: They should NOT belong to an ethnic group.
questionList.choiceD: They should NOT belong to a religious group.

questionList.questionStatement: An altruist is identified by his/her readiness to
questionList.choiceA: Lead people in protests against injustice.
questionList.choiceB: Oppose any form of dictatorship and tyranny.
questionList.choiceC: Sacrifice ones happiness and welfare for others.
questionList.choiceD: Use any means to gain power and respect

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is a characteristic feature of the demography of developing nations?
questionList.choiceA: High birth rate and High death rate.
questionList.choiceB: High birth rate and low death rate..
questionList.choiceC: Low birth rate and High death rate.
questionList.choiceD: Low birth rate and low death rate.

questionList.questionStatement: What is ethics? It is a
questionList.choiceA: Collection of moral standards accepted by society.
questionList.choiceB: Part of philosophy that studies moral standards
questionList.choiceC: Set of rules and regulations issued democratic states.
questionList.choiceD: Reference material on moral standards issued by UNO.

questionList.questionStatement: Ten countries are elected for a period of two years to serve in the Security Council taking into consideration their
Which of the following is an attribute of a person who is self confident?
What does wise saving mean?
questionList.choiceA: Saving money even before satisfying your basic needs.
questionList.choiceB: Saving money after satisfying all your personal wants
questionList.choiceC: Saving money after satisfying your basic needs.
questionList.choiceD: Saving money by reducing from your basic needs.

questionList.questionStatement: Any place where the Ethiopian flag is flown, be in embassy or on ship, is considered as:
questionList.choiceB: Territory free from any international obligations.
questionList.choiceC: Free transit area for Ethiopian trade with others.
questionList.choiceD: An integral Part of the host country or area.

questionList.questionStatement: For citizens to understand their rights and duties properly laws and rules should be
In Ethiopia it is possible to get rid of many off the communicable diseases by:
questionList.choiceA: Teaching the people to keep personal hygiene.
questionList.choiceB: Distributing medicines in the disease prone areas.
questionList.choiceC: Increasing the number of health professionals.
questionList.choiceD: Building health centers and make them accessible.

questionList.questionStatement: Accountability of state requires a government to:
questionList.choiceA: Consult elected representatives before making any decision.
questionList.choiceB: Settle its accounts and make them for auditing on time.
questionList.choiceC: Take responsibility for all its decisions and functions.
questionList.choiceD: Build modern and trustworthy financial system.

questionList.questionStatement: During state of emergency the Ethiopian government could take action that could
questionList.choiceA: Dismantle all articles of the constitution.
questionList.choiceB: Limit the democratic rights of citizens.

questionList.questionStatement: What does domesticating of international laws and norms mean?
questionList.choiceA: Fashioning domestic laws and norms with the international ones
questionList.choiceB: Changing the international ones to suit the conditions of the land
questionList.choiceC: Including some domestic provisions to the international ones
questionList.choiceD: Making the international laws and norms part of the law of the land

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following functions is exclusively given to the Federal Government of Ethiopia by the Constitution?

questionList.choiceB: The fact that all rebellions were attached to land question
questionList.choiceC: The fact that all rebellions were suppressed by military action a supported by air force.
questionList.choiceD: The fact that all rebellions took place in northern Ethiopia

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following African country is associated to a fairly recent phenomenon of genocide?

questionList.choiceA: By assigning women to all key positions in the government it
questionList.choiceB: By creating equal chance and opportunities for both men and women
questionList.choiceC: By increasing the number of women politicians
questionList.choiceD: By providing free chance of education for women

questionList.choiceA: Help them remember how and where the crime is done.
questionList.choiceB: Prove that the legal system works in transparent manner.

questionList.choiceD: Reinforce popular confidence in legal system of the nation.

questionList.questionStatement: Who is the Commander in Chief of the FDRE armed forces?
questionList.choiceD: The Chief of Staff of the army.

questionList.choiceA: It is the most utilized river in Ethiopia
questionList.choiceB: It is the bond that links Ethiopia, Egypt and Sudan
questionList.choiceC: It is the only cross-boundary river in Ethiopia
questionList.choiceD: It is the only river that has never attracted the attention of Europeans

questionList.questionStatement: The fight against corruption could bear fruit if the government in power
questionList.choiceA: Pays high salaries for its officials to deter them from taking bribe.
questionList.choiceB: Manages to make all its officials honest and truthful.
questionList.choiceC: Is fully committed to root out corrupt practices in the country.

questionList.questionStatement:
Read the following data carefully and answer the question that follows.
CountryLiteracy rateInfant mortality rateLife expectancy rateGDP/person(USD)
A44.6%94.4%45 years146.8
B98%5.6%80 years4,000.00
From the table above it can be safely concluded that
questionList.choiceA: Literacy rate has positive relation with infant mortality.
questionList.choiceB: Literacy rate has positive relation with life expectancy.
questionList.choiceC: Infant mortality has positive relation with life expectancy.
questionList.choiceD: Infant mortality rate has positive relation with GDP growth.

questionList.questionStatement: Identify the correct statement concerning HIV/AIDS from the given alternatives
questionList.choiceA: HIV/AIDS has become a great obstacle against socio-economic development among societies
questionList.choiceB: The victims of HIV/AIDS can no longer contribute to the development endeavors of their respective nations
questionList.choiceC: Globalization and human mobility played their part in the expansion of HIV/AIDS
questionList.choiceD: HIV/AIDS is the only incurable disease

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is INCORRECT?
questionList.choiceA: Ethiopia is the seat of many international organizations
questionList.choiceB: Ethiopia is a member of many international organizations
questionList.choiceC: Ethiopia is the seat of ECOWAS
questionList.choiceD: Ethiopia is a founding member of OAU

questionList.questionStatement: What could be the essential base for Ethiopias development endeavors?
questionList.choiceA: Better education and fostering socio-cultural values
questionList.choiceB: The Grand Millennium Dam which is under construction
questionList.choiceC: The expansion of global information centers
questionList.choiceD: Opening new legal migration opportunities to citizens

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is NOT among the moral values of Ethiopian societies?
Which of the following statements is correct regarding the prevalence of rule of law?
questionList.choiceA: It forms a state dominated and ruled by judges.
questionList.choiceB: It hinders the smooth functioning of courts.
questionList.choiceC: It establishes rule by law courts and judges.
questionList.choiceD: It guarantees the safety and security of citizens.

questionList.questionStatement: A self-reliant person is one who is
questionList.choiceA: Self-sufficient in everything and requires no help from others.
questionList.choiceB: Dependable to find solutions for serious social problems.
questionList.choiceC: Refuses to accept the opinion of others at any time.
questionList.choiceD: Aware of her/his own strengths and weaknesses.

questionList.questionStatement: Great scientists and thinkers of all times contributed great thing driven primarily by their desire to
questionList.choiceC: Transform their country and the world.
questionList.choiceD: Earn respect for their creations and thoughts.

questionList.questionStatement: Ethnocentrism is a belief that one's own ethnic group is superior in everything to others. Therefore it
questionList.choiceA: Insures respect by other ethnic groups.
questionList.choiceB: Demands the loyalty of other ethnic groups.
questionList.choiceC: Deserves recognition by other ethnic groups.
questionList.choiceD: Hinders interaction with other ethnic groups.

questionList.questionStatement: Article 20/7 of the FDRE constitution stipulates that an accused person has a right to:
questionList.choiceA: Be tried in a court that uses language of the accused.
questionList.choiceB: Request for assistance of an interpreter at government expense.
questionList.choiceC: Keep silent and refuse to give testimony against oneself.
questionList.choiceD: NOT to appear in court and NOT to be accused of contempt of court

questionList.questionStatement: Identifying the commonly shared values, interests and goals of the Ethiopian nations, nationalities and peoples and respecting them is important to:
In theory, markets in free market economies are regulated by the relationship between demand and supply. What does this statement imply?
questionList.choiceA: There could be other practical factors that regulate free market economy
questionList.choiceB: Demand and supply exist only in the markets of free market economy.
questionList.choiceC: Other types of economies do NOT have a theory that regulates them.
questionList.choiceD: Free market economy is healthy because Demand and Supply grow equally.

questionList.questionStatement: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights is incorporated in the FDRE constitution. This is significant because it:
questionList.choiceA: Guarantees full respect of the stated rights for the peoples of Ethiopia.
questionList.choiceB: Compels future governments to respect them for the people of Ethiopia.
questionList.choiceC: Will serve as a standard for respect of human rights in the country.
questionList.choiceD: Enables the UN to take action against a government that abuses them.

questionList.questionStatement: Unlike previous times the nations, nationalities, and peoples of Ethiopia have the right to:
questionList.choiceA: Promote and develop their language and culture.
questionList.choiceB: Move and settle anywhere in the country.
questionList.choiceC: Join the various ranks of the countrys civil service.
questionList.choiceD: Marry into and live together with other ethnic groups.

questionList.questionStatement: League of Nations has indirectly encouraged the 1935 Italian invasion of Ethiopia by:
questionList.choiceA: Forbidding Russia to come to the support of Ethiopia.
questionList.choiceB: Impeding British and French support to Ethiopia:
questionList.choiceC: Passing arms embargo on both Ethiopia and Italy.
questionList.choiceD: Refusing to send peace keeping troops to Ethiopia.

questionList.questionStatement: If a government truly respects rule of law in any country then
questionList.choiceB: There is no need to hold periodic elections.
questionList.choiceC: It is NOT necessary to have courts and prisons.
